pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.2: the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was socializing with a householder and their child.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.3: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.4: “How can Venerable Caṇḍakāḷī socialize with a householder and their child?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī does this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.8: “… How can the nun Caṇḍakāḷī do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.9: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.11.1: ‘If a nun is socializing with a householder or a householder’s child, the nuns should correct her like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.12: “Venerable, don’t socialize with householders or householders’ children. Be secluded, Venerable. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.13: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.14: If she then stops, all is well. If she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.6: she socializes with improper bodily and verbal actions.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.10: whoever is a child or a sibling.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.14: Other nuns who see it or hear about it. They should correct her like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.15: “Venerable, don’t socialize with householders or householders’ children.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.17: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.18: And they should correct her a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.20: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.21: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.22: If those who heard about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.23: That nun, even if she has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.24: “Venerable, don’t socialize with householders or householders’ children.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.26: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.27: They should correct her a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.29: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.30: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.32: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.33: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.34: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.35: The nun so-and-so is socializing with householders and householders’ children.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.36: And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.37: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should press her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.39: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.40: The nun so-and-so is socializing with householders and householders’ children.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.41: And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.42: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.43: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.44: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.45: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.46: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.47: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.48: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.49: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.50: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.51: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.3.2: if she has not been pressed;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.3.6: The sixth training rule is finished.
